# scaleMode

**Instance Property**

A setting that defines how the scene is mapped to the view that presents it.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var scaleMode: SKSceneScaleMode { get set }
```

```swift
var scaleMode: SKSceneScaleMode { get set }
```

## Discussion

It is possible for a scene’s size to differ from the size of the view it is presented in. The scale mode determines how the visible portion of the scene is mapped to the view. The possible values are listed in [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKSceneScaleMode]. The default value is [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKSceneScaleMode/fill].

## Stretching Content to Fit the View

- **Scaling a Scene’s Content to Fit the View**: Configure the scale mode to determine how a scene is sized to fit its view.
- **SKSceneScaleMode**: The modes that determine how the scene’s area is mapped to the view that presents it.
